thread.title: PAGASA: Danger level heat index in 27 areas on May 11
thread.title_full: PAGASA: Danger level heat index in 27 areas on May 11

author: VNExplorer
title: PAGASA: Danger level heat index in 27 areas on May 11
text: Vacationers enjoy swimming in the cold waters of Misibis Bay in Cagraray, Bacacay, Albay in the Bicol Region on Saturday, May 4, 2024. According to PAGASA, the province may expect a heat index of 40 to 41 degrees Celsius, classified as under ‘Extreme Caution’, this weekend. DANNY PATA State weather bureau PAGASA said 27 areas would have a heat index in the danger level on Saturday. According to PAGASA’s heat index forecast as of 5 p.m. Friday, the following areas will have heat indexes between 42°C and 46°C. 42°C: NAIA, Pasay City Sinait, Ilocos Sur MMSU, Batac, Ilocos Norte Iba, Zambales Cubi Point, Subic Bay, Olongapo City Sangley Point, Cavite Legazpi City, Albay Cuyo, Palawan Masbate City, Masbate Iloilo City, Iloilo Catbalogan, Samar Tacloban City, Leyte Zamboanga City, Zamboanga del Sur Davao City, Davao del Sur 43°C: Tuguegarao City, Cagayan ISU Echague, Isabela San Jose, Occidental Mindoro CBSUA-Pili, Camarines Sur Dumangas, Iloilo Catarman, Northern Samar Guiuan, Eastern Samar 44°C: Laoag City, Ilocos Norte Aparri, Cagayan Puerto Princesa City, Palawan Roxas City, Capiz 45°C: Dagupan City, Pangasinan 46°C: Virac (Synop), Catanduanes Baguio City and Benguet State University, La Trinidad, Benguet will continue to have the lowest heat index at 26°C. According to PAGASA, areas with a heat index of 42°C to 51°C fall within the danger level. Individuals exposed to heat in said areas are in danger of heat cramps, heat exhaustion, and heat stroke. PAGASA advised the public to limit outdoor activity, remain hydrated, and wear fresh clothes to avoid heat-related illnesses. — Jiselle Anne Casucian/VBL, GMA Integrated News This article was originally published in GMA News Online.News Related - Recall Just Announced For Popular Cookies Featured In Holiday Gift Baskets Anyone who’s purchased gift baskets to hand out to loved ones this holiday season might need to find a backup present after the latest food recall that involves festive cookies.
